image.altText: Anthony Albanese meets Xiao Qian

items.synopsis: The trip is expected to be heavy with symbolism, marking the 50th anniversary of Gough Whitlam's historic visit to China.

title.children: Albanese makes landmark China visit, promising to 'cooperate where we can, disagree where we must'

image.altText: Jordan's King Abdullah II and Queen Rania walking in formal wear beside a fence.

items.synopsis: As the war between Israel and Gaza escalates, the conflict is shifting dynamics within the Middle East. In Jordan, the outbreak of violence has evoked longstanding fears the kingdom cannot remain immune to regional instability.

title.children: 'Could explode at any moment': Why war in Israel is making Jordan's King and Queen so nervous

image.altText: An employee of DP World walking along the Melbourne wharves

items.synopsis: Lots of multinational companies use legal means to reduce the amount of tax they pay. If governments supported companies that paid more generously, it might shift the dial on what's considered acceptable.

title.children: Lots of companies pay little to no tax. It's often totally legal. But should taxpayers reward them?

items.synopsis: Former Greek finance minister Yanis Varoufakis says capitalism is dead and that we are now "serfs" for the likes of Jeff Bezos and Elon Musk.

title.children: Are we big tech's slaves? Meet the economist who thinks we are 'cloud-serfs'

image.altText: Stephanie, Zoe and Oliver sitting close together and smiling at the camera

items.synopsis: Stephanie says a letter from the National Disability Insurance Agency that said her six-year-old daughter could lose her funding earlier than expected came as a shock.

title.children: Mother shocked by NDIA's demand for proof daughter 'disabled enough' to keep funding

image.altText: A close-up headshot of Ivanka Trump. She wears a red top and silver earrings. Her hand rests on her chin.

items.synopsis: Donald Trump's daughter distanced herself from politics and attempted a reset after her father's election loss. But she's now being forced to testify in his fraud trial, and there's a huge amount at stake.

title.children: Ivanka Trump tried and failed to avoid a court date. It could lead to big problems for her dad

image.altText: A woman's hands resting in her lap. She's wearing rings, bracelets and a watch

items.synopsis: Migrant experts say the current system gives perpetrators of family violence control over women's visa status.

title.children: 'You will be my wife otherwise no one else can have you': How Australia's migration system is failing women

image.altText: Kirrilly, left, throws her head back in laughter as she stands next to Rick, right, who laughs too.

items.synopsis: Kirrilly feels "a little bit braver" about pursuing a career in the arts after spending the day fashioning a floppy summer hat with Rick on Old People's Home for Teenagers.

title.children: Master milliner Rick made headpieces for Nicole Kidman. Now he's passing his knowledge to a teenager

image.altText: close up of packest of lamb cutlets on Coles shelf

items.synopsis: Too many sheep is bad news for farmers but the oversupply should drive down costs for customers.

title.children: Australia's sheep industry is in downturn, so when will chops get cheaper?

image.altText: A group of short statured women wearing green and gold basketball singlets and holding an Australian flag smile at camera.

items.synopsis: In July, Australia made history by sending a women’s basketball team to the World Dwarf Games for the first time and winning a silver medal.

title.children: Feeling more confident, active and happier: What the World Dwarf Games mean

image.altText: A young man with his blond hair combed back smiles at the camera

items.synopsis: The headmaster of Shore School in Sydney has been criticised over a newsletter he wrote describing Lilie James's accused murderer as an "absolute delight".

title.children: Elite Sydney school principal criticised for saying Lilie James's accused killer was 'not a monster'

image.altText: Portrait of a smiling young man wearing his cycle lycra and helmet

items.synopsis: Fresh out of high school, 17-year-old Cooper Williams is about to ride from Tasmania to Brisbane and Port Macquarie to champion men's health.

title.children: Teen embarks on 4,000km bike ride to show people 'anything is possible'

image.altText: A female footballer player lies on the ground after injuring her knee.

items.synopsis: Season-ending knee injuries are becoming more common among female athletes in Australia's football codes, leaving medical experts  increasingly concerned with the rise in this trend.

title.children: 'Australia is about to see a tsunami of ACL injuries' warns surgeon who fixed Ellie Carpenter's knee

image.altText: Woman painting young girl's hand with Aboriginal flag

items.synopsis: A Yugerra woman in the Victorian electorate with the strongest No vote wants young Indigenous people involved in education, governance and policy making, after the heartbreak of the referendum outcome.

title.children: Teen calls for more young First Nations decision makers, saying 'our voices are needed' after No result

image.altText: Eddie Jones holds up his thumb

items.synopsis: Eddie Jones' Barbarians are well beaten by Wales at the Millennium Stadium in Cardiff, but the match was overshadowed by sexual assault allegation against Baa Baa's player Api Ratuniyarawa on the morning of the match.

title.children: Eddie Jones' Barbarians beaten amidst sexual assault allegation against a player

image.altText: Robin, aged 11, sits next to his dad William and holds a framed picture of Greg with a dog on the farm.

items.synopsis: A Canberra father has applied in the Federal Court to compel the Australian Communications and Media Authority to ban alcohol advertising during televised sport, after his brother died at a young age as a result of alcohol abuse.

title.children: William and his son Robin are on a mission to ban alcohol ads during televised sport

image.altText: An outback setting

items.synopsis: Queensland's fire service has offered its deepest condolences to the families of those onboard, and confirmed the aircraft had been contracted to support the Queensland bushfire response.

title.children: Three dead after firefighting plane crashes in outback Queensland

image.altText: A graphic displaying a number of jockeys.

items.synopsis: Irish galloper Vauban looks set to run favourite in Tuesday's great race, but who will be the toughest to beat? Explore our interactive form guide to the horses set to line up in the 163rd Melbourne Cup.

title.children: The 2023 Melbourne Cup field has been decided. Here's your guide to the runners

image.altText: British comedian Russell Brand performs.

items.synopsis: The suit follows a recent flurry of allegations made against the 48-year-old performer by several women accusing him of sexual assault and inappropriate behaviour.

title.children: UK comedian Russell Brand facing further sexual assault allegations in New York lawsuit

image.altText: A middle-aged African man in a military uniform with a red beret speaks while seated in a leather chair.

items.synopsis: The former junta leader is back in custody, his lawyer has said, denying Camara was a willing participant in an earlier armed jailbreak that he described as a kidnapping by force.

title.children: Guinea's ex-junta leader Moussa Daddis Camara detained after 'kidnapping' from prison

image.altText: Two male cricketers in yellow celebrate, one facing the other, pumping his fist

items.synopsis: Adam Zampa continues his remarkable resurgence following the spinner's poor start to the tournament, dismissing the dangerous Ben Stokes to kill off England's chances.

title.children: Australia delivers final blow to England's dismal World Cup defence

image.altText: Palestinians pull a damaged ambulance after it was hit in a strike.

items.synopsis: Israel says the ambulance strike in Gaza City was targeting Hamas militants, while Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu rejects calls for a ceasefire unless hostages are released.

title.children: Several reported killed in Israeli attack on ambulance convoy near Gaza's largest hospital

image.altText: A woman and man walking inside an aiport being greeted by three women with flowers. Faces are pixelated.

items.synopsis: An Adelaide family who were holidaying and visiting relatives in Gaza when the conflict broke out have returned home safely.

title.children: Adelaide family back on home soil after fleeing war-torn Gaza

image.altText: A man's hand holds a beer in a bar.

items.synopsis: Decriminalisation of public drunkenness takes effect in Victoria next week and a new sobering-up centre just for First Nations people will open on the same day.

title.children: Victoria's second sobering-up centre announced for St Kilda for First Nations people

image.altText: A woman's heavily tattooed right arm, holding a cup of coffee

items.synopsis: Here's what you need to know about decaf coffee: how it's made, the flavour, the benefits — and whether it's actually caffeine-free.

title.children: How is decaf coffee made? And is it really caffeine-free?

image.altText: Kiwis players and coaches celebrate defeating the Kangaroos in the Pacific Championships final.

items.synopsis: Considered underdogs heading into the Pacific Championships final, New Zealand stuns World Cup winners Australia with a 30-0 victory in Hamilton.

title.children: Kiwis hammer Kangaroos in record-breaking win to claim Pacific Championships title

image.altText: A roof has collapsed and flames can be seen inside a two storey brick building as a lone firefighter sprays water into a window

items.synopsis: More than 100 years of regional Victorian footy history has been wiped out in a fire police described as suspicious.

title.children: Victorian town's sporting hub burnt down in 'suspicious' fire

image.altText: A plume of smoke over a freeway

items.synopsis: Firefighters have spent the day battling multiple infernos in Western Australia, after lightning strikes sparked several blazes overnight.

title.children: Homes and lives under threat from multiple fires burning in Western Australia

image.altText: A headless status in a open casket held upright

items.synopsis: Thermal baths, working class neighbourhoods and a headless statue are some gems archaeologists have uncovered in Rabat as excavation work continues.

title.children: Ancient statue among discovery in new ruins unearthed at Chellah, Morocco

image.altText: A group of solar panels on a roof through the frame of leafy trees.

items.synopsis: While most Australians are stuck with inflated fixed-rate power prices, some are saving money by playing the spot market. So how are they doing it, and why isn't it for everyone?

title.children: Consumers tapping the spot power market are cleaning up, covering 'a month's bill' in a night

image.altText: A young bull rider hangs on with one hand as the animal gets airborne in a ring surrounded by cowboy spectators.

items.synopsis: Twelve-year-old mini-bull rider Ronan Miosge is one tough hombre. He has been bucked off mini bulls since he was eight and keeps coming back for more.

title.children: Queensland rodeo prodigy takes on world's best at mini-bull riding championships in Texas
